item.title: Wuthering Waves: Banners, Pulling, and Priority Guide
item.description:
As a Gacha game, Wuthering Waves uses a pulling system that allows players to acquire new Resonators (characters) with some RNG involved. Since Gacha games often personalize this mechanic, some players might find the basics of pulling confusing and have questions about the Banners in Wuthering Waves . This guide simplifies the fundamentals and offers tips on prioritizing the most effective pulls from the current draws.

Related
Wuthering Waves: All Free Characters (& How to Get Them)

In Wuthering Waves, there are several free characters that you can obtain during your adventure, so knowing how to do so is important.

Wuthering Waves’ Pulls and Gacha Explained

In Wuthering Waves, the pulling system is called Convene . Using this feature, players can spend special tickets (called Tides) to summon new characters, with chances of drawing 4-Star or 5-Star Resonators.

The pulling mechanic features a classic 50-50 Pity System . Each time players use 10 Lustrous Tides, they are guaranteed a 4-Star character or item. After 80 summons, the Pity System will either grant the featured Resonator or weapon of that Banner, or their equivalent. If the Pity doesn’t activate, the player's next pull after 80 summons is guaranteed to be the featured character or item.

There's a chance of encountering Soft Pity around 60 to 75 draws, which could potentially reward players with high-Star items before reaching the 80 draws quota.

How to Unlock Pulling in Wuthering Waves

In Wuthering Waves, the Convene unlocks by the time the player accesses the Training Simulation . To reach this point, follow along with the main campaign missions until you unlock Jinzhou city. After that, you can summon new characters from the designated menu accessible from the Terminal.

Players can use reroll tricks to pull their favorite Resonators early on in the game.

List of Current Banners in Wuthering Waves

There are currently five Banners on the Convene menu: three permanent and two event-exclusive. Here's what players can pull from each Banner.

Permanent Banners

  • Novice Convene : The first 50 Convenes guarantee one of three 5-Star Resonators : Jianxin, Lingyang, or Encore. After 50 Convenes, the Banner transforms into the Beginner’s Choice Convene, allowing players to target one of the following 5-Star characters: Jianxin, Calcharo, Verina, Lingyang, or Encore.
  • Tidal Chorus : This Banner grants the player one 5-Star character in 80 Convenes. T he options are Encore, Jianxin, and Lingyang.
  • Winter Brume : In this Banner, players can target a 5-Star weapon, with the options being Emerald of Genesis, Lustrous Razor, Static Mist, Abyss Surges, Cosmic Ripples.

Temporary (Event) Banners

  • Prevail the Lasting Night (Event) : After 80 Convenes, the player might pull Jiyan or an alternative 5-Star: Danjin, Mortefi, or Chixia . (The currency for this event is Radiant Tide.)
  • Absolute Pulsation (Event) : This Banner guarantees a 5-Star weapon of the player’s choice after 80 pulls. However, unlike permanent Banners, this weapon event requires Forging Tides, which are relatively scarce.

Priority Guide for Convene Attempts

Beginner Wuthering Waves players are advised to prioritize the Novice Convene (Utterance of Marvels) banner for two reasons. First, it offers a 20% discount on Lustrous Tide, granting a guaranteed item every eight pulls instead of ten. Second, it unlocks Beginner’s Choice Convene in 50 pulls, allowing the player to select the next Resonator they want to target.

Here is the Banner priority order for the best outcome:

  • Verina (Support)
  • Calcharo (DPS)
  • Encore (DPS)
  • Jianxin (DPS)

For the limited-time Convene Events, players are recommended to pull for Jiyan in the "Prevail the Lasting Night" Banner. The reason is that Jiyan’s Banner includes better substitute Resonators, with Mortefi and Danjin (two top-tier characters) being available as well. So, if the Pity System goes wrong, players are still rewarded with worthy replacements.

For the Permanent Weapon Banner, the priority choices are:

  • Static Mist : 12.8% Energy Regen + 10% ATK DMG buff for the switched-in Resonator for 14 seconds.
  • Lustrous of Razor : 12.8% Energy Regen + 7% Resonance Liberation DMG buff, stackable two times.
  • Emerald of Genesis :12.8% Energy Regen + Liberation DMG buff by 7%, stackable up to two times for 12 seconds.

How to Add a Resonator to the Wish List

Wuthering Waves doesn’t have a Wish List for targeting specific Resonators. However, one alternative is the Beginner’s Choice Convene, which is unlocked by investing 50 Convenes in the Utterance of Marvels Banner. Using this Banner, the player can wish one of the following 5-Star characters: Jianxin, Calcharo, Verina, Lingyang, or Encore.

item.title: Wuthering Waves: Resonators Guide (Elements, Stats, Skills, & More)
item.description:
Wuthering Waves has plenty of different mechanics that make the game so enjoyable to learn as you get started with your first playthrough. Among the various things to learn in the game, Resonators are one of the most important.

Resonators are essentially characters that you can control during your adventures, and each one has its own unique skills. There are quite a few things to learn regarding Resonators to give yourself a better understanding of how they function, and how you can grant yourself an advantage in certain situations. For this reason, learning information about Resonators, such as their Elements, Skills, and Stats, and how these aspects all function will go a long way.

Related
How to Get Wuthering Waves Twitch Drops

Find out how to get Wuthering Waves’ Twitch Drops and get a little headstart on your journey using this quick guide.

Resonators in Wuthering Waves

In Wuthering Waves , Resonators are characters that can be obtained and played. Resonators are, for the most part, restricted to being acquired through the Convenes, which are part of the in-game gacha mechanic. However, there are also a few characters that can be obtained for free at various points of your playthrough. Every player should end up with at least some Resonator variety after investing a bit of time in the game.

Resonator Elements & Weapons

In Wuthering Waves , every Resonator will have one of six different elements assigned to them. These elements are set and cannot be changed, as they determine the type of damage dealt by the Resonator's attacks in battle. By knowing the element of each Resonator in the game, you can determine which characters you may want to use alongside one another and consider various builds and team compositions .

Weapons are also a core feature of each Resonator, with five different types available in the game. While elements determine the type of damage a Resonator will deal, weapon type will determine how a Resonator functions in combat. For this reason, it's also important to consider each Resonator's weapon type to establish a balanced build , as some Resonators may synergize together better than others.

Every Resonator in the game has been listed below, along with their rarity, element, and weapon:

Resonator

Element

Weapon Type

Rarity

Rover (Spectro)

Spectro

5 Star

Related
Wuthering Waves: All Ascension Materials Location

It's essential for Resonators to collect ascension materials if they want to level up their characters in Wuthering Waves.

Resonator Stats

During Wuthering Waves gameplay, you will control your Resonators in combat. Each Reasonator has different strengths and weaknesses determined by the numbers in their stats. Learning what each stat means can help you identify the strengths and weaknesses of each Resonator, which will help you to determine which direction you want to progress forward in for your character builds . Every Resonator stat has been identified below with a brief explanation of what each one means, or how it affects your character in combat.

Resonator Stat

How it Works

HP

Resonator's maximum health

ATK

Resonator's offensive power

DEF

Resonator's defensive power

Max Stamina

Determines maximum stamina and how quickly the stamina bar depletes.

Crit Rate

Chance of triggering a critical hit when dealing damage.

Crit. DMG

Damage multiplier when triggering a critical hit.

Energy Regen

Increases the amount of Resonance Energy gained when using Basic Attacks, Resonance Skills, Combat Forte, and Resonance Energy.

Resonance Skill DMG Bonus

Increases damage dealt by Resonance Skills.

Basic Attack DMG Bonus

Increases damage dealt by Basic Attacks

Heavy Attack DMG Bonus

Increases damage dealt by Heavy Attacks.

Resonance Liberation DMG Bonus

Increases damage dealt by Resonance Liberation.

Physical DMG Bonus

Increases damage dealt by Physical Attacks.

Glacio DMG Bonus

Increases damage dealt by Glacio Attacks.

Fusion DMG Bonus

Increases damage dealt by Fusion Attacks.

Electro DMG Bonus

Increases damage dealt by Electro Attacks.

Aero DMG Bonus

Increases damage dealt by Aero Attacks.

Spectro DMG Bonus

Increases damage dealt by Spectro Attacks.

Havoc DMG Bonus

Increases damage dealt by Havoc Attacks.

Physical DMG RES

Damage resistance to incoming Physical Attacks.

Glacio DMG RES

Damage resistance to incoming Glacio Attacks.

Fusion DMG RES

Damage resistance to incoming Fusion Attacks.

Electro DMG RES

Damage resistance to incoming Electro Attacks.

Aero DMG RES

Damage resistance to incoming Aero Attacks.

Spectro DMG RES

Damage resistance to incoming Spectro Attacks.

Havoc DMG RES

Damage resistance to incoming Havoc Attacks.

Healing Bonus

Increases the amount of healing provided by the Resonator.

Resonator Skills

Lastly, every Resonator in Wuthering Waves will come equipped with a set of six different combat abilities known as Resonator Skills. Knowing how each of these Skills works and what they will do in combat will enable you to become a master of battle and surpass complicated boss fights with much more ease.

Resonator Skill

How it Works

Basic Attack

A Resonator's normal attack that is always available for use. The button can be held down to deliver a Heavy Attack.

Resonance Skill

Each Resonator can use their Resonance Skill to deliver special attacks, buffs to their allies, or de-buffs to the enemy. This skill has a timed cooldown between each use.

Resonance Liberation

This powerful ability only becomes available through successfully delivering other combat attacks and maneuvers, and must be charged up again after one use is expended.

Forte Circuit

This ability is unique to each Resonator . It is a Resontator's most powerful, or ultimate, attack.

Outro Skill

Abilities that activate when a Resonator is switched out of battle.

Intro Skill

Abilities that activate when a Resonator is switched into battle.

item.title: Street Fighter 6: How To Activate Shin Akuma
item.description:
Every character in Street Fighter 6 has a unique playstyle, allowing players to choose whoever fits their preferences. Having this, as well as a lot of accessibility, lets the game branch out to more players who were not interested in the franchise before.

With the launch of Akuma in Street Fighter 6 , all the characters that were previously announced by Capcom at the game's launch have been released. Players who have purchased Akuma using Fighter Coins and tried him in battle might have missed a key part of his kit that is hidden. Here's how to unlock it.

Related
Street Fighter 6: 8 Possible Season 2 Characters

Season 2 for Street Fighter 6 is on the horizon. Which characters are most likely to make a comeback?

How To Activate Shin Akuma In Street Fighter 6

Shin Akuma is a form in Street Fighter 6 that can be acquired after completing a few prerequisites, basically Taunts while in a fight. Players can perform Taunts by pressing all Punches and all Kicks simultaneously. You can also bind Taunt to a button you do not use by going into the Control Settings.

After the fight starts, press Back Taunt , which makes Akuma sit down on the floor and look at his opponent from behind. After a few seconds, Akuma will look in the other direction. This will be your cue to press Down Taunt. Ideally, you should wait a second or two before pressing Down Taunt, which will cause Akuma to take out the rice and start eating it little by little. This slowly increases your Super meter. Once it is full, you will see an animation on Akuma shortly before he stands up in Shin Akuma mode. His appearance does not change after going into the form, so only by performing the attacks can tell you whether you are in the form or not.

It's worth noting that this form is nearly impossible to reach while in a fight. This is because most opponents will not let you complete the animation and get more Super Arts.

Related
Street Fighter 6: The Best Master Gifts in World Tour Mode (SF6 Gift Guide)

Figuring out the best gift for every World Tour mode Master will make it much easier for players to reach the maximum bond and unlock Outfit 2.

How To Perform The Hidden Arts

Akuma has a Hidden Special Move and two Super Arts. The commands are as follows:

Hidden Art

Image

Commands

How To Perform

Double Zanku Hadoken

J214PP

Forward Jump, Down Back Quarter Circle Punch, Punch. This means you can press any two punches after jumping into the air.

Misogi

214214K

Down Back Quarter Circle, Down Back Quarter Circle, Kick. Pressing any Kick will work for this Super.

Kongou-Kokuretsuzan

22PPP

Down, Down, All Punches. You can either press all the punches simultaneously or bind this input as a command.

Akuma is also a World Tour Master, and you can gift items to increase his Bond Level and acquire his Outfit 2 .

item.title: Fallout 76 Fan Makes Wholesome Outpost Dedicated to New Players
item.description:
Highlights

  • Free items, helpful advice, and buffs are available at a Fallout 76 player's wholesome outpost for new Vault Dwellers.
  • The outpost offers tips on crafting, preserving items, and maximizing XP benefits, showcasing a welcoming gameplay community.
  • Special bases like this may enhance Fallout 76's popularity and encourage player retention through positive interactions.

A Fallout 76 fan has made an incredibly wholesome outpost to help new players with materials, food, and more. As Fallout 76 has seen improved player numbers recently, some long-time fans are looking for ways to make it easier for new gamers to get started.

Fallout 76 was released to a mixed reception, but Bethesda has continued adding new content to the game since then. Among the big updates to the game were Wild Appalachia, Wastelanders, Steel Dawn, and Expeditions: The Pitt. Some players have returned to Fallout 76 since the release of Amazon Prime Video's Fallout series , and it has seen a warmer reception than on launch day. As some players stuck around through the updates, they've found ways to improve the new player experience. One gamer has shared images of their bunker that they've dedicated to helping low-level characters which includes tips on how to play the game.

Related
Fallout 76 Player Gets Incredible View of Nuke Detonating While Out Exploring

A Fallout 76 player stumbles on an impressively imposing view of a nuclear bomb detonation during their adventures in Appalachia.

Reddit user Tesla_Wolf recently shared 12 images of their Fallout 76 bunker that offers tips and items for new Vault Dwellers. Their entrance has two Vault Boy standees with monster heads pointing to a sign that says "new players welcome." The first stop revolves around Crafting, with Armor and Weapons Workbenches, and storage full of food ingredients. A sign explains that Fallout 76 Junk can be scrapped to reduce weight next to an ammo station, while another room is dedicated to explaining the costs of dying and how players can preserve items. There's an area full of wall-mounted enemies, and a nearby room has a Fortune Wizard machine that can provide buffs.

What Will New Fallout 76 Player Gain From This Bunker?

  • Free items
  • Helpful advice
  • Buffs
  • XP boost

Further helpful advice that players may receive from this base is the XP benefit to sleeping, the helpful nature of keeping people out of a base using locks, and the effectiveness of wireless power with Pylons. Multiple stops allow players to test these tips, including an electricity station and a room with Vending Machines. In one Vending Machine, the player offers most items for free alongside wholesome messages like "pls leave for new players" and "happy reclamation day." Should new Vault Dwellers visit this helpful base, they may leave with some useful items, get a better idea of how to play the game, and what's needed for an effective Fallout 76 CAMP .

With multiple bases dedicated to helping new Vault Dwellers, CAMPs like this may help further improve the game's popularity. Fallout 76 isn't the only live service game with an impressive community, but wholesome places like this highlight the positivity in the game. As Bethesda continues to update Fallout 76 , new systems may further streamline the new player experience.

item.title: Pokemon Scarlet and Violet Reveal Seven-Star Tera Raid for June 2024
item.description:
Highlights

  • Swampert the Unrivaled will have the Poison-Tera type for the Seven-Star Tera Raid battle. Players will get the Mightiest Mark for any Pokemon that defeats it.
  • The battle will start on Thursday, May 30, at 8:00 PM Eastern and end on Sunday, June 2 at 7:59 PM Eastern.
  • A second round for the raid will run from June 6 to June 9 for Pokemon Scarlet and Violet players.

Following the end of a limited-time Paradox Tera Raid, Pokemon Scarlet and Violet revealed that the next Seven-Star Tera Raid battle will pit trainers against Swampert the Unrivaled. The upcoming fight against Swampert will test Pokemon Scarlet and Violet players, as this boss Pokemon has a versatile move pool of different types.

Known as the Mud Fish Pokemon, Swampert is a Water and Ground Pokemon that debuted in Pokemon Ruby and Sapphire . It is the final form of Mudkip, the Water-type starter of the Hoenn Region. Swampert is depicted as a blue Pokemon that can swim on all fours and deal extreme damage to enemies in different ways. Statistically, Swampert is among the more balanced Pokemon in physical and special attack coverage. While it is a slower critter with 60 base speed, Swampert's attack and HP stats are its highest, with its special attack and defenses not far behind. As of The Indigo Disk DLC, Pokemon Scarlet and Violet players can catch a Mudkip in the Terarium and evolve it into Marshtomp and Swampert.

Related
Pokemon Fan Designs Impressive Paradox Forms

A Pokemon fan artist creates several Paradox forms for Pokemon from previous game generations and shares their handiwork with others.

With the Paradox Tera raids against Sandy Shocks and Iron Thorns concluded, Pokemon Scarlet and Violet players will soon have a new foe to face. According to Serebii.net, the Seven-Star Tera Raid battle against Swampert the Unrivaled begins on Thursday, May 30, at 8:00 PM Eastern, and ends on Sunday, June 2, at 7:59 PM Eastern. Pokemon trainers who miss out on this raid will have another shot the following weekend, from June 6 to June 9 at the same start and end times. Swampert the Unrivaled will have the Poison type as its Tera type and grant the Mightiest Mark to any Pokemon that can defeat it.

Pokemon Scarlet and Violet Confirm June 2024 Seven-Star Tera Raid

  • Swampert the Unrivaled will have the Poison-Tera type.
  • Starts on Thursday, May 30, at 8:00 PM Eastern.
  • Ends on Sunday, June 2, at 7:59 PM Eastern.
  • A second round will run from June 6 to June 9.

As with other Seven-Star Tera Raid bosses, Swampert the Unrivaled will have its Hidden Ability called Damp. This eliminates the use of Self-Destruct and similar moves. However, Self-Destruct moves are generally frowned upon in Pokemon Scarlet and Violet , so the ability is not as big a factor as Swampert's move versatility. The Mud Fish Pokemon can use moves like Poison Jab, Liquidation, Surf, Earthquake, and Ice Beam to lay waste to its enemies. Pokemon such as Orthworm , Mew, Slowbro, or Slowking may prove crucial in the fight against Swampert the Unrivaled, as each have moves or abilities that can lock down some of the boss Pokemon's attacks.

Though Pokemon Scarlet and Violet have a handful of Seven-Star Tera raid candidates left , the battle against Swampert crosses one of the remaining Pokemon off the list. What moves Swampert will use in the fight ahead remains to be seen.
